sen.j: 上方文化（かみがたぶんか）とは、大坂と京都を中心にした上方の地ではぐくまれてきた、
sen.e: Kamigata Bunka is a culture cultivated in Kamigata centered in Osaka and Kyoto.
Kamigata Bunka is a culture cultivated in Kamigata centered in Osaka and Kyoto.
Kamigata Bunka is a culture cultivated in Kamigata centered in Osaka and Kyoto.

sen.j: 衣・食・住・聖・性・真・善・美など、人生の諸相にあらわれる価値のすべてを指す。
sen.e: It refers every value of life such as food, clothing, housing, holiness, nature, truth, virtue and beauty.
It refers to every value of life such as food, clothing, housing, holiness, nature, truth, virtue and beauty.
It refers to every value of life such as food, clothing, housing, holiness, nature, truth, virtue and beauty.

sen.j: 陰翳に富み、優美なるを身上とする。
sen.e: It has delicate shades of meanings and elegance.
It has delicate shades of meanings and elegance.
It has delicate shades of meanings and elegance.

sen.j: 元禄時代（1688年―1704年）には上方の経済がめざましい発展をとげた。
sen.e: In the Genroku period (1688 – 1704) the economy of Kamigata developed remarkably.
In the Genroku era (1688 – 1704) the economy of Kamigata developed remarkably.
In the Genroku era (1688 – 1704) the economy of Kamigata developed remarkably.

sen.j: きわめて裕福な町人層が新しい文化の担い手になり、上方文化が生まれた。
sen.e: The wealthy townspeople became the leader of the new culture and Kamigata Bunka appeared.
The wealthy townspeople became the leader of the new culture and Kamigata Bunka appeared.
The wealthy townspeople became the leader of the new culture and Kamigata Bunka appeared.

sen.j: 上方とは「上かみ（皇居）のある方角」という意味で、京都およびその付近一帯をさすことば。
sen.e: Kamigata means 'the direction of Kami [Imperial Palace]' and refers to Kyoto and the area around Kyoto.
Kamigata means 'the direction of Kami (Imperial Palace)' and refers to Kyoto and its surrounding area.
sen.cmt: ‘ [ ]’ → ' ( )' the area around Kyoto → its surrounding area
sen.e: Kamigata means 'the direction of Kami (Imperial Palace)' and refers to Kyoto and its surrounding area.

sen.j: 日本史上、つねに大和民族の文化の中心でありつづけた。
sen.e: It always remained the center of the Yamato race culture in the history of Japan.
It always remained the center of the Yamato race culture in the history of Japan.
It always remained the center of the Yamato race culture in the history of Japan.

sen.j: 徳川時代に入ると、文化の東漸にともない次第に関東へも洗練された先進的な上方文化が移入され、化成期になって漸く江戸特有の文化が開花を見るに至った。
sen.e: Since the Edo period, with spreading culture eastward, refined and developed Kamigata Bunka also was also brought to Kanto gradually and finally in Kasei era the own culture of Edo flowered.
Since the Edo period began, with spreading culture eastward, refined and developed Kamigata Bunka was also brought to Kanto gradually, and finally in the Kasei era the own culture of Edo flowered.
sen.cmt: beganを追加、alsoを削除、theを追加しました。化成期は化政期の間違いのようです。
sen.e: Since the Edo period began, with spreading culture eastward, refined and developed Kamigata Bunka was also brought to Kanto gradually, and finally in the Kasei era the own culture of Edo flowered.

tit.e: The life and culture of Kamigata
The life and culture of Kamigata
The life and culture of Kamigata

sen.j: 物見遊山（お花見、お月見、紅葉狩り、お雪見など）
sen.e: Monomiyusan (a pleasure trip) including cherry-blossom viewing, moon viewing, viewing autumnal leaves and snow viewing
Monomiyusan (a pleasure trip) including cherry-blossom viewing, moon viewing, viewing autumnal leaves and snow viewing
Monomiyusan (a pleasure trip) including cherry-blossom viewing, moon viewing, viewing autumnal leaves and snow viewing

sen.j: - 心斎橋、伏見稲荷、お初天神
sen.e: Sinsaibashi, Fushimi Inari, Ohatsu-tenjin Shrine (Tsuyunoten-jinja Shrine)
Sinsaibashi, Fushimi Inari, Ohatsu-tenjin Shrine (Tsuyunoten-jinja Shrine)
Sinsaibashi, Fushimi Inari, Ohatsu-tenjin Shrine (Tsuyunoten-jinja Shrine)

tit.j: 上方歌舞伎（関西歌舞伎）

sen.j: - 坂田藤十郎、佐野川市松

sen.e: Sanjikkoku (a popular item of rakugo, literally, "30 koku")

tit.e: Ukiyozoshi (Literally, Books of the Floating World)
Ukiyozoshi (Literally, Books of the Floating World)
Ukiyozoshi (Literally, Books of the Floating World)

sen.e: Jiuta (a genre of traditional songs with samisen accompaniment)
Jiuta (a genre of traditional songs with samisen accompaniment)
Jiuta (a genre of traditional songs with samisen accompaniment)
Kamigata kodan (kodan storytelling in Kyoto and Osaka)
Kamigata kodan (kodan storytelling in Kyoto and Osaka)
Kamigata kodan (kodan storytelling in Kyoto and Osaka)

sen.j: 江戸時代前期の上方は地質の立派な着物を好み、染めや鹿子絞りも上方が早かったという。
sen.e: In the early Edo period, people liked kimono (Japanese traditional clothing) made of good quality materials in Kamigata and also dyed kimono and kanoko shibori (spot tie-dyeing) appeared earlier in Kamigata.

In the early Edo period, people in Kamigata liked kimono (Japanese traditional clothing) made of good quality materials and also dyed kimono and kanoko shibori (spot tie-dyeing) appeared earlier in Kamigata.
sen.cmt: in Kamigataの位置を変更しました。
sen.e: In the early Edo period, people in Kamigata liked kimono (Japanese traditional clothing) made of good quality materials and also dyed kimono and kanoko shibori (spot tie-dyeing) appeared earlier in Kamigata.

sen.j: 元禄期には華やかな友禅染めがもてはやされ、衣服の贅沢は上方にとどめをさすといわれる位に豪華になった。
sen.e: In Genroku period, Yuzen-zome (fabrics dyed by a method invented by Yuzen MIYAZAKI) became very popular and it was said that there was no place like Kamigata to see luxury clothes.
In the Genroku era, Yuzen-zome (fabrics dyed by a method invented by Yuzen MIYAZAKI) became very popular and it was said that there was no place like Kamigata to see luxury clothes.
sen.cmt: In Genroku period → In the Genroku era
sen.e: In the Genroku era, Yuzen-zome (fabrics dyed by a method invented by Yuzen MIYAZAKI) became very popular and it was said that there was no place like Kamigata to see luxury clothes.

sen.j: 着物の隆盛は大坂町人の財力と美意識がささえていた。
sen.e: The prosperity of kimono was supported by the financial power and aesthetic sense of the townspeople of Kamigata.
The prosperity of kimono was supported by the financial power and aesthetic sense of the townspeople of Kamigata.
The prosperity of kimono was supported by the financial power and aesthetic sense of the townspeople of Kamigata.

sen.cmt: 用語集を参考に、(fine white noodles)を追加しました。

sen.e: Yokan (a bar of sweetened and jellied bean paste)
Yokan (a bar of sweetened and jellied bean paste)

sen.cmt: 用語集に統一しました。
sen.e: Proverbs and Koji Seigo (Chinese origin and proverbs)
Three years on a stone (Perseverance prevails).
Three years on a stone (Perseverance prevails).
Three years on a stone (Perseverance prevails).
A horse comes from a gourd (It was only a joke, but it has come true/Something unexpected has happened).
A horse comes from a gourd (It was only a joke, but it has come true/Something unexpected has happened).
A horse comes from a gourd (It was only a joke, but it has come true/Something unexpected has happened).

sen.j: 来年のことを言うと鬼が笑う
sen.e: If you talk about next year, devils will laugh at you.
If you talk about next year, devils will laugh at you.
If you talk about next year, devils will laugh at you.

tit.j: 上方を題材にした作品

sen.j: 元禄時代を中心として大坂と京都で行われた町人文学を上方文学という。
sen.e: Literature of the townspeople in Osaka and Kyoto mainly in the Genroku period is called Kamigata literature.
Literature of the townspeople in Osaka and Kyoto mainly in the Genroku era is called Kamigata literature.
Literature of the townspeople in Osaka and Kyoto mainly in the Genroku era is called Kamigata literature.

sen.j: 近世社会の仕組みが徐々にその姿をあらわすなかで、都市の多様な生活を描き、生命力にあふれた人間の心情と機微をとらえようとしたのが上方文学であった。
sen.e: While the system of modern society was gradually appearing in the society, Kamigata literature described the diversified urban life and energetic human emotions and the subtleties of feeling.
While the system of modern society was gradually appearing in the society, Kamigata literature described the diversified urban life and energetic human emotions and the subtleties of feeling.
While the system of modern society was gradually appearing in the society, Kamigata literature described the diversified urban life and energetic human emotions and the subtleties of feeling.

sen.j: そこにおおきな足跡を残したのが、浮世草子の井原西鶴、浄瑠璃の近松門左衛門、俳諧の松尾芭蕉の三人である。
sen.e: The three people - Saikaku IHARA who wrote Ukiyozoshi (Literally, Books of the Floating World), a joruri writer Monzaemon CHIKAMATSU and a haikai poet Basho MATSUO – have left major marks in it.
The three people - Saikaku IHARA who wrote Ukiyozoshi (Literally, Books of the Floating World), a joruri writer Monzaemon CHIKAMATSU and a haikai poet Basho MATSUO – have left major marks in it.
